newsitem.title: USA: Calif. Treasurer says state saves $6 mln on deals.
newsitem.headline: Calif. Treasurer says state saves $6 mln on deals.

text.p: California state Treasurer Matt Fong said on Tuesday the state would achieve present value savings of more than $6 million from Monday's public works board refunding revenue bond sales.

The sale of $116.6 million in Department of Corrections 1996 series B lease revenue refunding bonds garnered a true interest cost of 5.94 percent, and will generate a present value savings of $4.2 million, Fong said.
The second issue, the sale of $56.4 million in California Community Colleges 1996 Series B lease revenue refunding bonds, was sold at a true interest cost of 6.005874 percent.
Fong said the present value savings from the second issue would be nearly $2 million.
"We ... took advantage of a one-day window of opportunity in the bond market to complete the sale," Fong said.
Originally scheduled for September 4, the refundings were put off due to market conditions.
But Fong said a rally on September 13 made savings from the refundings feasible.
